channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MJAVADOC-554] Running javadoc:aggregate twice throws MavenReportException
item.project: Maven Javadoc Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
1. Open the attached testcase
  2. Run mvn clean install
  3. Run mvn javadoc::aggregate -e (the first time will succeed)
  4. Repeat mvn javadoc::aggregate -e
  5. Exception will be thrown:
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin:3.0.2-SNAPSHOT:aggregate (default-cli) on project javadoc-maven-report-exception: An error has occurred in Javadoc report generation: C:\Users\Gili\Documents\3rdparty\javadoc-maven-report-exception\target\site\apidocs\src\module1 -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin:3.0.2-SNAPSHOT:aggregate (default-cli) on project javadoc-maven-report-exception: An error has occurred in Javadoc report generation: C:\Users\Gili\Documents\3rdparty\javadoc-maven-report-exception\target\site\apidocs\src\module1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Another thing that's really bad about this issue is the exception message. It's not clear what (if anything) is actually wrong. Please provide more information when this exception is thrown.

Reproducible in version 3.0.1 with the following patch for Java 11 support:

<dependencies>
	<dependency>
		<groupId>org.ow2.asm</groupId>
		<artifactId>asm</artifactId>
		<version>7.0</version>
	</dependency>
</dependencies>
Pull request ready for review: https://github.com/apache/maven-javadoc-plugin/pull/15

Build succeeded in Jenkins: Maven TLP » maven-javadoc-plugin » MJAVADOC-554 #3

See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-box/job/maven-javadoc-plugin/job/MJAVADOC-554/3/

Build succeeded in Jenkins: Maven TLP » maven-javadoc-plugin » master #108

Thanks for the patch!
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-javadoc-plugin#835.
